newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares ease, seen lower by end Aug.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares ease, seen lower by end Aug.

text.p: Slovenian shares eased 0.12 percent on Wednesday and market participants said a gentle downward trend may continue to the end of August but forecast a rebound in September.
Creditanstalt analyst Gregor Kastelic noted investors would return from their holidays soon.
"Then some capital should to return to the market..and investors...may show confidence in the newly listed shares of strong privatised companies," he said.
Thirteen newly privatised companies have already been listed on the primary or OTC markets of the Ljubljana bourse and another 15 are expected by the end of the year.
* The seven-share SBI index eased 1.15 points to 982.92.
* Five shares fell and 10 rose, while eight were untraded.
* Turnover fell to 43 million tolars from 79.5 million.
* Financial consultancy Finmedia had the highest turnover and was the leading decliner, falling 3.14 percent to 15,842 tolars on volume of 575 shares for total turnover of 9.1 million tolars.

* Ordinary shares of bank Dolenjska banka were the top gainers, rising 3.2 percent to 10,916 on volume of 99 shares for total turnover of 1.1 million tolars. -- Marja Novak, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
